001package imagingbook.lib.filters;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
004
005/**
006 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
007 * 
008 * @author WB
009 * @version 2020/12/29
010 */
011public class Kernel2D {
012        
013        private final float[][] H;
014        private final int xc, yc;
015        private final int width, height;
016        
017        /**
018         * Convenience constructor.
019         * Assumes that the kernel's hot spot is at its center,
020         * does normalization by default.
021         * 
022         * @param H the 2D kernel array
023         */
024        public Kernel2D(float[][] H) {
025                this(H, (H[0].length - 1) / 2, (H.length - 1) / 2, true);
026        }
027        
028        /**
029         * Full constructor.
030         * 
031         * @param H the 2D kernel array
032         * @param xc the x-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (width-1)/2
033         * @param yc the y-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (height-1)/2
034         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
035         */
036        public Kernel2D(float[][] H, int xc, int yc, boolean normalize) {
037                this.H = (normalize) ? normalize(H) : Matrix.duplicate(H);
038                this.width = H[0].length;
039                this.height = H.length;
040                this.xc = xc;
041                this.yc = yc;
042                validate();
043        }
044        
045        private void validate() {
046                if (!Matrix.isRectangular(H))
047                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("non-rectangular filter kernel");
048                // TODO: should we check if xc/yc is inside the kernel? does it matter?
049        }
050        
051        public float[][] getH() {
052                return H;
053        }
054        
055        public int getWidth() {
056                return width;
057        }
058        
059        public int getHeight() {
060                return height;
061        }
062        
063        public int getXc() {
064                return xc;
065        }
066        
067        public int getYc() {
068                return yc;
069        }
070        
071        // ----------------------------------------------------------
072        
073        /**
074         * Normalizes the specified array such that its sum becomes 1.
075         * Throws an exception if the array's sum is zero.
076         * 
077         * @param A a 2D array
078         * @return the normalized array
079         */
080        public static float[][] normalize(float[][] A) throws ArithmeticException {
081                float s = (float) (1.0 / Matrix.sum(A));
082                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
083                        throw new ArithmeticException("zero kernel sum, cannot normalize");
084                return Matrix.multiply(s, A);
085        }
086
087}
